bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish qualifications for substitute teachers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-43 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person who is employed as a substitute teacher in any school in which teachers are required to be certified shall be at least a high school graduate, shall be at least twenty-one years of age and shall complete an eight-hour orientation program that addresses the following areas or shall otherwise demonstrate proficiency in the following areas: (1) Classroom management; (2) Student safety and health; and (3) School district policies and procedures. The school administration is responsible for supervision of the substitute teacher and for providing any testing or training necessary to meet the requirements of subdivisions (1) to (3), inclusive, of this section. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
